body_html:
I think the primary issue whether or not we want to have users to build NNPACK by default when they do a source install of PyTorch. Back when Trevor was originally adding NNPACK integration, @soumith and I came to the conclusion that NNPACK should be conda packages. Maybe the calculation is different now that we have third_party/NNPACK for free.

@soumith do you think things are different now?
body_text:
I think the primary issue whether or not we want to have users to build NNPACK by default when they do a source install of PyTorch. Back when Trevor was originally adding NNPACK integration, @soumith and I came to the conclusion that NNPACK should be conda packages. Maybe the calculation is different now that we have third_party/NNPACK for free.
@soumith do you think things are different now?
body:
I think the primary issue whether or not we want to have users to build NNPACK by default when they do a source install of PyTorch. Back when Trevor was originally adding NNPACK integration, @soumith and I came to the conclusion that NNPACK should be conda packages. Maybe the calculation is different now that we have `third_party/NNPACK` for free.

@soumith do you think things are different now?
